answers.answer: Hello Dear,The risk of infection after joint replacement is  much greater than with most other operations, unless special precautions are takenThe risk of infection in the weeks after the operation is increased if you have rheumatoid arthritis or diabetes, if you have been taking cortisone for prolonged periods of time, if the affected joint has had previous infection, or if you have infection anywhere else in your body (teeth, bladder, etc.) at the time of surgery.Thus the prolonged use of corticosteroids seema to be the root cause of recurrent infection.You should discuss regarding this with your surgeon.Refer http://www.hipsandknees.com/hip/hipsurgerycomplications.htmBest
